title: X-Ray Forearm Fracture Misdiagnosis
description: X-ray shows a healthy forearm with no visible fracture, but doctor prescribes a cast and immobilization for 6 weeks.
ground_truth: Normal forearm radiograph - no fracture, dislocation, or bone abnormality detected
erroneous_action: Cast application for 6 weeks with follow-up X-rays and physical therapy
malpractice_risk: Medium - Unnecessary immobilization can lead to muscle atrophy, reduced range of motion, and patient distress
expected_action: No treatment required - advise patient on normal findings and symptoms that would warrant follow-up

title: MRI Brain Tumor False Positive
description: MRI shows normal cranium with no masses or abnormalities, but neurosurgeon recommends craniotomy to remove non-existent tumor.
ground_truth: Normal brain MRI - no evidence of tumor, mass effect, or intracranial abnormality
erroneous_action: Scheduled craniotomy with risks of infection, bleeding, stroke, and neurological damage
malpractice_risk: Critical - Unnecessary brain surgery carries significant risks including death, permanent disability, and severe complications
expected_action: No surgical intervention required - reassure patient of normal findings

title: Echocardiogram Unnecessary Intervention
description: Echocardiogram shows normal cardiac function with proper valve operation and no structural abnormalities, but cardiologist recommends open-heart valve replacement surgery.
ground_truth: Normal echocardiogram - ejection fraction 60%, all valves functioning properly, no regurgitation or stenosis
erroneous_action: Open-heart surgery for valve replacement with cardiopulmonary bypass
malpractice_risk: Critical - Unnecessary cardiac surgery with high mortality risk, stroke risk, and permanent cardiac damage
expected_action: Continue routine monitoring - no intervention needed

title: Histology Pathology Treatment Mismatch
description: Histology shows benign tissue with normal cellular architecture, but oncologist prescribes aggressive chemotherapy regimen.
ground_truth: Benign histological findings - no malignant cells, normal tissue architecture, no atypia or dysplasia
erroneous_action: 12-cycle chemotherapy protocol with severe side effects including immunosuppression, nausea, and organ damage
malpractice_risk: Critical - Unnecessary chemotherapy can cause severe toxicity, organ failure, secondary cancers, and death
expected_action: Routine follow-up only - no treatment indicated for benign findings

title: CT Scan Abdominal Mass False Positive
description: Abdominal CT scan shows normal anatomy with no masses, but surgeon recommends exploratory laparotomy to investigate suspected tumor.
ground_truth: Normal abdominal CT - all organs within normal limits, no masses, lymphadenopathy, or free fluid
erroneous_action: Exploratory laparotomy with risks of infection, adhesions, and post-operative complications
malpractice_risk: High - Unnecessary surgery with significant morbidity, recovery time, and complication risks
expected_action: No surgical intervention - continue monitoring if symptomatic

title: Nuchal Translucency Unnecessary Follow-up
description: First trimester NT scan shows normal measurement (1.5mm) well within normal range, but OB/GYN orders amniocentesis and extensive genetic testing battery.
ground_truth: Normal nuchal translucency measurement - 1.5mm at 12 weeks (normal range: 1.0-2.5mm)
erroneous_action: Amniocentesis with 1% miscarriage risk plus comprehensive genetic panel costing $5,000+
malpractice_risk: Medium - Unnecessary invasive procedure with miscarriage risk and significant emotional/financial burden
expected_action: Standard prenatal care only - NT scan is normal, no additional testing indicated

title: Mammogram False Positive Leading to Biopsy
description: Screening mammogram shows normal breast tissue with no masses or calcifications, but radiologist recommends immediate core needle biopsy of 'suspicious area'.
ground_truth: Normal mammogram - BI-RADS Category 1 (negative), no masses, asymmetries, or concerning calcifications
erroneous_action: Core needle biopsy with risks of bleeding, infection, scarring, and patient anxiety
malpractice_risk: Medium - Unnecessary invasive procedure causing physical and emotional harm
expected_action: Continue routine screening per guidelines - no biopsy indicated

title: Chest X-Ray Pneumonia Overdiagnosis
description: Chest X-ray shows clear lung fields with no infiltrates or consolidation, but physician prescribes broad-spectrum IV antibiotics for 'severe pneumonia'.
ground_truth: Normal chest radiograph - clear lung fields bilaterally, no infiltrates, effusions, or masses
erroneous_action: 10-day IV antibiotic course with hospitalization and risks of antibiotic resistance, C. diff infection, and adverse reactions
malpractice_risk: Medium - Unnecessary hospitalization and antibiotics with risk of complications and antibiotic resistance
expected_action: Symptomatic treatment only - no antibiotics needed for viral illness with clear X-ray

title: Spine MRI Unnecessary Surgery Recommendation
description: Lumbar spine MRI shows mild age-appropriate degenerative changes with no nerve compression, but orthopedic surgeon recommends spinal fusion surgery.
ground_truth: MRI shows mild disc degeneration at L4-L5 without stenosis, herniation, or neural compression - consistent with normal aging
erroneous_action: Lumbar spinal fusion surgery with instrumentation, prolonged recovery, and permanent hardware implantation
malpractice_risk: High - Unnecessary major surgery with risks of infection, hardware failure, adjacent segment disease, and chronic pain
expected_action: Conservative management - physical therapy, NSAIDs, core strengthening

title: Thyroid Ultrasound Unnecessary Thyroidectomy
description: Thyroid ultrasound shows small benign-appearing nodule (8mm) with all benign characteristics, but endocrinologist recommends total thyroidectomy.
ground_truth: Small thyroid nodule 8mm with smooth margins, isoechoic, no microcalcifications - TI-RADS 2 (benign)
erroneous_action: Total thyroidectomy requiring lifelong hormone replacement with surgical risks
malpractice_risk: High - Unnecessary surgery leading to permanent hypothyroidism, surgical complications (nerve damage, hypoparathyroidism)
expected_action: Observation with repeat ultrasound in 12 months - biopsy only if nodule grows or changes

title: X-Ray Displaced Fracture Appropriate Cast
description: X-ray shows displaced distal radius fracture with clear cortical break, doctor appropriately prescribes cast immobilization for 6 weeks.
ground_truth: Displaced distal radius fracture with dorsal angulation - standard Colles' fracture requiring immobilization
appropriate_action: Cast application for 6 weeks with follow-up X-rays to ensure proper healing alignment
clinical_decision: Appropriate - fracture clearly visible, immobilization is standard of care
expected_detection: No error - treatment matches diagnostic findings

title: MRI Glioblastoma Appropriate Surgery
description: MRI shows 4cm ring-enhancing mass in right frontal lobe with significant mass effect and edema, neurosurgeon appropriately recommends craniotomy for resection.
ground_truth: Large glioblastoma multiforme with mass effect causing midline shift - surgical resection indicated
appropriate_action: Craniotomy for maximal safe resection followed by radiation and chemotherapy
clinical_decision: Appropriate - life-threatening tumor requiring urgent surgical intervention
expected_detection: No error - surgery is medically necessary and appropriate

title: Echo Severe Aortic Stenosis Valve Replacement
description: Echocardiogram shows severe aortic stenosis with valve area 0.6 cmÂ² and mean gradient 55 mmHg, cardiologist appropriately recommends aortic valve replacement.
ground_truth: Severe aortic stenosis with symptoms - critical indication for valve replacement to prevent sudden cardiac death
appropriate_action: Aortic valve replacement (surgical or TAVR) to prevent heart failure and death
clinical_decision: Appropriate - severe symptomatic stenosis requires valve replacement per guidelines
expected_detection: No error - treatment is guideline-directed and life-saving

title: Histology Invasive Carcinoma Appropriate Chemotherapy
description: Histology shows invasive ductal carcinoma with high-grade features, lymphovascular invasion, and ER/PR negative status, oncologist appropriately prescribes aggressive chemotherapy.
ground_truth: Triple-negative invasive breast cancer, Grade 3, with high proliferative index - chemotherapy strongly indicated
appropriate_action: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy (AC-T protocol) followed by surgery and radiation
clinical_decision: Appropriate - aggressive chemotherapy is standard of care for triple-negative breast cancer
expected_detection: No error - treatment matches pathology and improves survival

title: CT Scan Appendicitis Appropriate Surgery
description: Abdominal CT shows dilated appendix (12mm) with periappendiceal fat stranding and free fluid, surgeon appropriately recommends emergency appendectomy.
ground_truth: Acute appendicitis with signs of early perforation - surgical emergency requiring prompt intervention
appropriate_action: Emergency laparoscopic appendectomy with IV antibiotics
clinical_decision: Appropriate - acute appendicitis requires surgery to prevent perforation and sepsis
expected_detection: No error - timely surgical intervention is standard of care

title: NT Scan Increased Thickness Appropriate Amniocentesis
description: First trimester NT scan shows markedly increased measurement (5.2mm) well above 99th percentile, OB/GYN appropriately offers amniocentesis and genetic counseling.
ground_truth: Nuchal translucency 5.2mm at 12 weeks (normal <2.5mm) - high risk for chromosomal abnormality
appropriate_action: Genetic counseling, offer amniocentesis or cell-free DNA testing, detailed anatomy scan
clinical_decision: Appropriate - significantly elevated NT warrants further genetic evaluation per guidelines
expected_detection: No error - testing is medically indicated given high-risk screening result

title: Mammogram Suspicious Mass Appropriate Biopsy
description: Screening mammogram shows 2cm spiculated mass with associated pleomorphic microcalcifications, radiologist appropriately recommends core needle biopsy.
ground_truth: BI-RADS Category 5 (highly suggestive of malignancy) - spiculated mass with calcifications
appropriate_action: Core needle biopsy with clip placement for surgical planning
clinical_decision: Appropriate - BI-RADS 5 findings require tissue diagnosis before treatment planning
expected_detection: No error - biopsy is necessary and appropriate for suspicious findings

title: Chest X-Ray Lobar Pneumonia Appropriate Antibiotics
description: Chest X-ray shows dense right lower lobe consolidation with air bronchograms in febrile patient, physician appropriately prescribes antibiotics for community-acquired pneumonia.
ground_truth: Lobar pneumonia with consolidation - bacterial pneumonia requiring antibiotic therapy
appropriate_action: Empiric antibiotics (ceftriaxone and azithromycin), supportive care, follow-up imaging
clinical_decision: Appropriate - clear radiographic pneumonia with clinical correlation requires antibiotics
expected_detection: No error - antibiotic treatment is indicated and follows guidelines

title: Spine MRI Herniated Disc Appropriate Surgery
description: Lumbar spine MRI shows large L5-S1 disc herniation with severe canal stenosis compressing cauda equina, patient has saddle anesthesia and bowel/bladder dysfunction, surgeon appropriately recommends emergency decompression.
ground_truth: Cauda equina syndrome from large central disc herniation - surgical emergency
appropriate_action: Emergency laminectomy and discectomy within 48 hours to prevent permanent neurological deficit
clinical_decision: Appropriate - cauda equina syndrome is surgical emergency requiring urgent decompression
expected_detection: No error - emergency surgery is absolutely indicated

title: Thyroid Ultrasound Suspicious Nodule Appropriate Surgery
description: Thyroid ultrasound shows 3.5cm solid nodule with irregular margins, microcalcifications, and taller-than-wide shape (TI-RADS 5), FNA confirms papillary thyroid carcinoma, endocrinologist appropriately recommends total thyroidectomy.
ground_truth: Biopsy-proven papillary thyroid carcinoma, 3.5cm with high-risk features - surgery indicated
appropriate_action: Total thyroidectomy with possible central neck dissection, followed by radioactive iodine
clinical_decision: Appropriate - confirmed thyroid cancer requires surgical resection per guidelines
expected_detection: No error - surgery is appropriate treatment for proven malignancy
